content: the visual inspiration for the the gaitherin shawl is of linked arms and hands people s heads visible in a crowd out-stretched arms and heads coming together visible in the shawl s knitted texture the slipped-stitch ribbed texture is worked in stripes allowing the yarns to mingle and come together to create a beautiful tweed-like fabric a subtle nod to the woolly good gathering s location and scottish textile traditions the edges of the shawl are worked in a neat i-cord and the deceptively simple stitch patterning soon becomes intuitive as the shawl grows **sizes** finished depth 45 cm / 16 5 in finished width 185 cm / 73 in measurements are approximate and taken at widest points after blocking **gauge** 26 sts and 48 row over 10 cm / 4 in in textured stripe stitch block your swatch according to the finishing directions before measuring the gauge is not critical for this project but will affect the amount of yarn used and the size of the finished shawl **needles** main needles 3 25 mm or size needed to match gauge **yarn** c1 zakami yarns merino fingering 100% fine merino 400 m / 437 yds per 100g skein c2 zakami yarns suri fluffy lace 75% baby suri alpaca 25% silk 420 m / 459 yds per 50g skein 1 skein of each sample 1 c1 tea and honey c2 light love and prosperity or in 4ply/fingering and laceweight yarn which knits to the specified gauge and has similar characteristics such as good stitch definition and drape if you are using a variegated colourway or a yarn with texture e g a boucle yarn use this as c2 approximate yardage required c1 370 m / 405 yds c2 320 m / 350 yds **techniques** reading charts optional slipped stitches kfb increase ssk decrease i-cord **notions** tapestry needle 3 lockable stitch markers or safety pins weighing scales optional **n b ** if you re using the charted instructions slipped sts are always slipped purlwise and on the rs they are slipped wyib and on ws wyif
